chapter.title: Working with Triggers
chapter.para: The following sections describe how to work with (hotfolder) triggers (for more information, see ) and timer tasks (for more information, see ). The following actions are supported in the Triggers view:

sect1.title: Defining a Trigger
sect1.para: You can define a custom trigger. You can configure the desired properties directly in the overview table.
Proceed as follows to create a new trigger.

step.para: Switch to the Triggers view.

In the navigation bar of the view, click Button Create
(Create).

result.para: A new entry with empty fields is created in the overview table. The ID field contains mandatory information and is therefore highlighted in red (marked as incorrect) while it does not contain a valid value.

step.para: In the Repetitions field, indicate how many times the trigger is to the executed. With the default value -1, the number of repeats is not limited (i.e. the trigger is executed an infinite number of times within the specified interval).
In the Interval field, enter the time interval in milliseconds in which the trigger should be executed.
If required, enter a brief text about the trigger in the Comment field.

Click Save button
(Save) to save the new trigger and exit the editing mode.

result.para: The editing mode is terminated and the new trigger is displayed in the overview table.

step.para:
Click Cancel button
(Cancel) to cancel the creation of the trigger and exit the editing mode without saving the trigger.

sect1.title: Listing Triggers
sect1.para: You can display an overview of the configured triggers in the workspace of the Triggers view.
The overview table displays the following information for each configured trigger by default:

listitem.para: The (user defined) unique identifier of the trigger.

Number of repeats. Specifies how many times the trigger is to the executed. With the default value -1, the number of repeats is not limited (i.e. the trigger is executed an infinite number of times within the specified interval).
The time interval in which the trigger is executed Specified in milliseconds.
You can add comments to document special features or usage of the trigger.

sect1.title: Displaying Trigger Details
sect1.para: You can display the details for a specific trigger in the details pane. Compared to the overview table, the details pane contains an additional information element.
The following information is currently available in the details pane:

listitem.para: The (user defined) unique identifier of the trigger.
Currently, only the value triggers is supported.

Number of repeats. Specifies how many times the trigger is to the executed. With the default value -1, the number of repeats is not limited (i.e. the trigger is executed an infinite number of times within the specified interval).
The time interval in which the trigger is executed Specified in milliseconds.
You can add comments to document special features or usage of the trigger.

sect1.title: Modifying a Trigger
sect1.para: You can edit the trigger properties.

note.para: Please keep in mind that you cannot use this action to modify the trigger ID (user-defined name of the trigger). You can modify the number of repeats, trigger interval and comment. To modify the trigger ID (name), create a new trigger with the desired name (see ).

sect1.para: Proceed as follows to edit the values of an existing trigger:

step.para: Switch to the Triggers view.
Double-click the desired row in the overview table.

result.para: The entry switches to editing mode.

step.para: In the Repeats field, specify a new value.
In the Interval field, enter the new time interval in milliseconds at which the trigger should be executed.
If required, enter a brief text about the trigger in the Comment field.

Click Save button
(Save) to save the trigger with the updated values and exit the editing mode.

result.para: The editing mode is terminated and the trigger is displayed with the updated values in the overview table.

step.para:
Click Cancel button
(Cancel) to cancel the trigger update and exit the editing mode without saving the changes.

sect1.title: Modifying Multiple Triggers
sect1.para: You can edit selected values for multiple triggers in one step.

note.para: Please keep in mind that with this function, you define the same values for all selected triggers.

sect1.para: Proceed as follows to edit the properties of the selected triggers.

step.para: Switch to the Triggers view.
Select at least two triggers from the overview table.

In the navigation bar of the web interface, click Icon Edit
(Edit).
Tick the checkbox in front of each value you want to change for all selected triggers.
In the Repetitions field, indicate how many times the selected triggers are to be executed.
In the Interval field, specify the time interval in milliseconds in which the selected triggers are to be executed.
If required, enter a brief text about the selected triggers in the Comment field.
Click OK to save the changed settings for all selected triggers and close the dialog.

result.para: The changed settings for the selected triggers are displayed in the overview table and in the details pane.

step.para: Click Cancel to close the dialog without changing the settings.

sect1.title: Deleting a Trigger
sect1.para: Use this action to delete a single trigger or multiple triggers. Proceed as follows to delete existing triggers.

step.para: Switch to the Triggers view.
Select at least one trigger from the overview table.

In the navigation bar of the view, click Button Delete
(Delete).

result.para: The confirmation dialog Delete Triggers opens.

step.para: In the confirmation dialog Delete Triggers, click OK to delete the selected trigger (or triggers).
In the confirmation dialog Delete Triggers, click Cancel to close the dialog without deleting the selected trigger(s).

result.para: If the triggers have been successfully deleted, a success message is displayed.
If the triggers could not be deleted, the corresponding error message is displayed.
